intro: Pseudalbizzia niopoides var. niopoides, commonly known as the African wisteria, is a deciduous leguminous tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pendulous flower clusters. The plant is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowering display. Additionally, it plays a role in soil stabilization and may have traditional uses in local communities.
